meanings.sent1: I had to disinvite my friend from the party because it was canceled.
meanings.sent2: She decided to disinvite her coworker to the dinner after their argument.
meanings.sent3: The host had to disinvite the noisy neighbor to maintain peace at the gathering.
meanings.sent4: Disinviting someone felt like taking back a gift you already gave.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disinvite him was difficult, but necessary for the event's success.

meanings.sent1: They had to disinvite the uninvited guests who showed up unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The couple had to disinvite some guests due to limited space at the venue.
meanings.sent3: The host had to disinvite the party crashers to maintain order.
meanings.sent4: Disinviting people last minute was a stressful task for the event planner.
meanings.sent5: She had to disinvite her ex-boyfriend to avoid any drama at the wedding.
